subject: Re: Any way to speed up the scanning on the 12-469?-A couple more questions
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Here's what you need to know, Zack:

The scan rate can only be increased by about 10%, because the radio's 
internal scan rate is not over-ridden. Pulsing the Input at a higher 
rate than 90% of the internal clock is seen as a constant button push.

Hope that helps...

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:
>

rate

> >>>

> >>> The chip is a microcontroller. It needs a program
> > called "firmware" put into it before it will do anything useful. 
The
> > chips have a program memory which comes blank when you buy
> > them.The "code" is the representation of what is called machine
> > language that tells the various parts of the microcontroller what 
to
> > do. In this case, I imagine it increases a voltage with a certain
> > pattern and then drops it down to zero, starting over again and
> > repeating at a certain rate. This would produce a repetitive 
sweep of
> > the radio at a certain rate when the microcontroller is hooked up 
to
> > the radio correctly.It wouldn't be difficult for me to write my 
own
> > program to do this with a PIC microcontroller, but if someone else
> > has already done it, why bother?If I can't get my hands on the
> > machine code, I'll write some myself.ZackOn Fri, 4 Jan 2008,
